My personal favorite of all time, too bad people don't play it as much anymore, especially in my country... Despite the gameplay, which I find extremely pleasing, relaxing and dynamic, Counter-Strike Source meant community, family, friendship and fun. Back then, I didn't know anything about competitive matchmaking, but the community servers and the fun, the jokes, as well as the people you had the change to meet and play with, were part of something big that I'll always remember with joy and happiness. 
You may not be the most popular game in the world, but be sure that you have a special place in my heart ‚ù§Ô∏è.

Better than CS:GO and plays almost the same as CS 1.6 but looks much better and does not have that many bugs as CS 1.6. Playing CSS makes people happy and playing CS:GO makes people angry, and if you enjoy playing 1.6 you will fill right at home here.

Great Game!

-Chill community

-I prefer the weapons in CS:S from the ones in CS:GO (idk they feel better)

-Runs on any computer

-Pretty active 3-10k players online

8/10

P.S. Try to get it during a sale. I personally bought it full price but I didn't regret it

CS:S is undoubtedly my favorite Counter-Strike game. There's just something about the Source engine that just makes it unique. There are plenty of populated servers to play on, all with people of varying talent. All the classic Counter-Strike weapons return and feel powerful, but require some skill to use. CS:GO is good, but there's something about it that I just don't like. The downside with this one is that it costs money whereas CS:GO is free to play. So ultimately, I'd say check this one out. It's pretty good.
